bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to J. Gil Cardenas, July 30, 1920

div1.p: Carter informs Cardenas that he will be acting Sanitary Advisor of the Peruvian Government until January, 1921, when Gorgas will take over the post.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to J. Gil Cardenas, July 30, 1920
div1.opener:

Comisión Sanitaria
para los Departamentos de
Piura y Tumbes
???
de
____Lima, Peru.__________de 192
July 30, 1920.
Dr. J. Gil Cardenas,
Director of Public Health,
Lima, Peru.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
At the request of General Gorgas I consented, April 3rd, 1920, to act
as his substitute as “Sanitary Advisor of the Peruvian Government” until he
could assume the position himself, which he purposed to do in January 1921.

Before engaging in this work it was necessary for me to return to
the United States because, being still on the active list of the United States
Public Health Service- Assistant Surgeon General and Colonel,- I could not do
so until retired.

I purpose to act as sanitary adviser of this Government, as aforesaid
until the beginning of next year, unless the yellow fever situation should then
require it, would prefer not to remain longer. The functions and duties of this
position are I think sufficiently indicated by its designation, and the under-
standing entered into with General Gorgas.

For the present I think that I can be of the most service to Peru
by undertaking the complete elimination of yellow fever from here from and for
the immediate future at least, would advise that I undertake supervision of
this work and serve at the seat of activities, i.e., in the Department of
Piura. I will of course however be ready to advise in the Health Conditions
on any other matter of sanitation.

The proposition of General Gorgas was that I receive a compensation
of $1000.00 per month and the travelling expenses incident to this service,
from the time) date of my leaving ---- Washington, to my return thereto.

I will add that I was engaged in work of some value to Peru, in
connection with the Piura epidemic for about two months, prior to my return
to the United States.

closer.signed:
Henry R. Carter, M.D.,L.L.D.,
Assist. Surgeon General, U.S.P.H.S.
